main event: A civilian in Columbus, Ohio reported a ground-radar observation of 2 or 3 pencil-shaped, solid-colored objects with flashing lights for 4 seconds on June 17, 1956.
interesting points: The observation was limited due to the short duration of the sighting, occurring in overcast conditions.
The report was received at 1905 hours and was made by a civilian, with the details of the call from Columbus, Ohio documented.
The witness saw the object for 20 seconds in just a trace of daylight and noticed faint sound associated with it.
The questionnaire included the witness drawing a picture of the object's shape, estimating its size and comparing it to common objects held in the hand.
Various details such as the object's brightness, motion, apparent solidity, and its disappearance from view were inquired about in the questionnaire.
sighted object: 2 or 3 pencil-shaped, solid-colored objects with flashing lights
